intro: Lobelia bivonae, commonly known as the Hawaiian lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks. Lobelia bivonae is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in areas with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species and is protected in its native range.
